item.title: Wrapped Banano Launch
item.description: If you’ve been following Banano at all then you may have heard of something called “Wrapped Banano.” If you haven’t been following Banano then I recommend you take a look at the community and their yellow paper to learn more. Wrapped Banano is a token on the Binance Smart Chain backed 1:1 by regular Banano. You first deposit Banano to a custodial wallet and the balance is attributed to you on the Wrapped Banano BSC bridge, you wrap the Banano by signing a transaction on the Binance Smart Chain with your metamask wallet.
item.content:
If you’ve been following Banano at all then you may have heard of something called “Wrapped Banano.” If you haven’t been following Banano then I recommend you take a look at the community and their yellow paper to learn more.

Wrapped Banano is a token on the Binance Smart Chain backed 1:1 by regular Banano. You first deposit Banano to a custodial wallet and the balance is attributed to you on the Wrapped Banano BSC bridge, you wrap the Banano by signing a transaction on the Binance Smart Chain with your metamask wallet. The end result is wBAN tokens in your metamask wallet, the same number of tokens as Banano you deposited in the beginning.

The initial press release has all the juicy details.

item.title: Launching the Banano Pay-Test
item.description: When I forked the accept-nano libraries I noticed they had created a very simple example site that leverages unpkg.com to offer a static one-page payment solution. Since I forked the rest of the library I decided I might as well host the example site somewhere so we could show off the speed of banano, and this little idea was born! Behold, paytest.banano.live! A one-stop shop for nothing! You can buy absolutely nothing for the low, low price of 0.
item.content:
When I forked the accept-nano libraries I noticed they had created a very simple example site that leverages unpkg.com to offer a static one-page payment solution. Since I forked the rest of the library I decided I might as well host the example site somewhere so we could show off the speed of banano, and this little idea was born!

Behold, paytest.banano.live! A one-stop shop for nothing! You can buy absolutely nothing for the low, low price of 0.01 banano. It’s quick, it’s feeless, it’s practically free!

Enter the desired amount of banano you’d like to donate to the cause, click on “Start” and you’ll receive a very simple payment prompt including a QR code. Scan the QR code (or copy and paste the address and amount), send, and you’ll see how quickly the site accepts your payment.

N.B. You are spending real banano during this transaction, it will be used for hosting fees, development, and tips on the lovely Banano discord.

item.title: Daily Rundown 04/27/2021
item.description: Photo from Pixabay Okay here we go, nearing the end of the backlog so hopefully these daily posts will wrap up soon. NANO WebGL PoW Demo Nano DPoW Banano BoomPoW Nginx Config Generator by DigitalOcean Nano RPC API Proxy GoNano payment library and API Nano tools on Github by BitDesert
item.content:
Photo from Pixabay

Okay here we go, nearing the end of the backlog so hopefully these daily posts will wrap up soon.

  • NANO WebGL PoW Demo
  • Nano DPoW
  • Banano BoomPoW
  • Nginx Config Generator by DigitalOcean
  • Nano RPC API Proxy
  • GoNano payment library and API
  • Nano tools on Github by BitDesert

item.title: Public Banano Nodes
item.description: Something I noticed recently while hanging out in on some Banano-related discord servers was that there didn’t appear to be a reliable list of the public Banano nodes. There were several requests from developers looking to connect to a node, so I had an idea. I forked SomeNano’s Nano Public Node site, and with a few minor changes… I created a Banano version! Introducing… public.banano.live! Link: https://public.banano.live
item.content:
Something I noticed recently while hanging out in on some Banano-related discord servers was that there didn’t appear to be a reliable list of the public Banano nodes. There were several requests from developers looking to connect to a node, so I had an idea. I forked SomeNano’s Nano Public Node site, and with a few minor changes… I created a Banano version!

Introducing… public.banano.live!

Link: https://public.banano.live
